snippet: Some political leaders, particularly in France, are feeling public heat because of unpopular government policies in response to Europe’s debt debacle.
abstract: Some European political leaders, particularly in France, are feeling public heat because of unpopular government policies in response to Europe’s debt debacle; analysts say they do not expect the European Central Bank, with its focus on fiscal discipline, to provide any quick remedies.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and RAPHAEL MINDER
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt, and Raphael Minder from Madrid. Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Some political leaders, particularly in France, are feeling public heat because of unpopular government policies in response to Europe’s debt debacle.

headline.seo: Central Bank Aid Not Expected in Euro Zone Crisis
headline.main: Central Bank Not Expected to Try to Ease Europe’s Crisis
headline.print_headline: Central Bank Not Expected To Try to Ease Europe’s Crisis
